the act of thinking again about a decision or opinion and deciding if you want to change it: They are calling for a serious reconsideration of the national drinking age. A motion for reconsideration was denied by the court. See
reconsider
More examplesFewer examplesThe review will involve a fundamental reconsideration of their priorities.They requested reconsideration of the proposals.The negotiations prompted reconsideration of the decision.

LAW the act of thinking about changing a decision, especially in a court of law: The court refused the appeal for reconsideration. The lawyers recommend that we seek reconsideration. The company will appeal to the Board for a reconsideration of its conclusions.
